negative_news: Honor, the mobile brand spun off from Huawei Technologies in 2020, emerged as China's biggest smartphone vendor in the three months through September, when the industry's largest market saw a second consecutive quarter of modest declines in spite of the launch of major new 5G handsets. Third-quarter smartphone shipments on the mainland fell 5 per cent year on year to 66.7 million units, according to a report on Thursday by tech market research firm Canalys. That compares to a 1 per cent decline
negative_impact:
• Apple Inc (AAPL) may face increased competition in the Chinese market as Honor, the mobile brand spun off from Huawei Technologies, has become the biggest smartphone vendor in the country. 
• Apple Inc (AAPL) may experience a decrease in sales in the Chinese market due to the 5% year-on-year decline in smartphone shipments in the third quarter. 
• Apple Inc (AAPL) may need to adjust its pricing strategy in order to remain competitive in the Chinese market, as Honor is known for its competitively priced products.

negative_news: "Labor issues in the automotive industry could impact our automotive business more in the fourth quarter than it did in the third quarter," CFO Edward Schlesinger said in an earnings call.  Corning supplies windscreens and emission control systems to the automotive industry and the strike comes as it grapples with slowing demand for its fiber cables from the telecom sector.  The optical communications unit, one of its main revenue generators, saw net sales fall by nearly a third as carriers worked through inventory.
negative_impact: 1. Apple Inc. (AAPL) could experience a decrease in demand for its products from the automotive industry. As the automotive industry grapples with labor issues and slowing demand for Corning's fiber cables, Apple Inc. could see a decrease in demand for its products from the automotive industry.2. Apple Inc. (AAPL) could experience a decrease in revenue from the telecom sector. As Corning's optical communications unit experiences a decrease in net sales due to carriers working through inventory, Apple Inc. could experience a decrease in revenue from the telecom sector.3. Apple Inc. (AAPL) could experience an increase in costs due to labor issues in the automotive industry. As the automotive industry grapples with labor issues, Apple Inc. could experience an increase in costs due to the need to pay higher wages to its employees in the automotive industry.

negative_news: Chinese e-commerce platforms including JD.com, PDD Holdings' Pinduoduo and Alibaba's Taobao are offering big discounts on Apple's latest iPhone 15, with some going for up to 1,501 yuan ($205.14) below the retail price.  Analysts say the iPhone 15 has not been selling as well in China as its predecessor.  Counterpoint Research said last week that iPhone 15 sales in China were down 4.5% compared with the iPhone 14, in the first 17 days after its market launch.
negative_impact: 1. Lower Profits: Apple Inc (AAPL) may experience lower profits due to the discounts offered by Chinese e-commerce platforms. This is because the discounts reduce the amount of revenue Apple Inc (AAPL) receives from the sale of the iPhone 15.2. Lower Market Share: The discounts offered by Chinese e-commerce platforms may lead to Apple Inc (AAPL) losing market share in the Chinese market. This is because the discounts make the iPhone 15 less attractive to potential customers, leading them to purchase other brands instead.3. Lower Brand Value: The discounts offered by Chinese e-commerce platforms may lead to a decrease in the perceived value of the Apple brand. This is because customers may perceive the discounts as a sign that the iPhone 15 is not as desirable as its predecessor, leading to a decrease in the perceived value of the Apple brand.
